verse: The prophet Elisha gave instructions to one of the prophets’ disciples.
The young prophet traveled to Ramoth-gilead.
When he got there, the military commanders were sitting together.
Jehu stood up, and he and the young prophet entered the house together. The young man anointed Jehu’s head with oil and spoke these words:
When Jehu appeared before his master’s servants, one of the commanders questioned him.
All the men quickly took off their coats and placed them before Jehu on the steps. They sounded the trumpet.
Jehu (son of Jehoshaphat, Nimshi’s son) began plotting against Joram. The entire community of Israel with Joram was defending Ramoth-gilead against Hazael (Aram’s king); but if you remember,
King Joram had gone to Jezreel to wait for his injuries to heal—the injuries the Arameans had given him while he was fighting against Aram’s king, Hazael.
Jehu took a chariot to Jezreel, where Joram was resting. As you may recall, Ahaziah (Judah’s king) was there visiting Joram.
The watchman was up on the watchtower in Jezreel, and he saw Jehu and his followers approaching.
A horseman went out and spoke to Jehu and his followers.
Joram summoned another horseman.
The watchman then went and updated Joram about the situation again.
Joram quickly realized that Jehu intended to attack, so he immediately turned his chariot around, quickly rode away, and yelled out to Ahaziah.
But Jehu pulled his bowstring back as far as he could. He released an arrow that struck Joram between his shoulder blades, piercing straight through his heart. Joram fell over in his chariot.
Ahaziah (Judah’s king) witnessed all of this from a distance, and he rode away by the path to Beth-haggan. Jehu went after him.
Ahaziah’s servants transported him to Jerusalem in a chariot. They buried him with his fathers in the city of David.
During the 11th year of Joram (Ahab’s son), Ahaziah inherited the throne over Judah.
When Jehu arrived in Jezreel, Jezebel was informed of his arrival. She put on her best make-up and fixed her hair, and she stuck her head out her window.
While Jehu rode through the gate, she taunted him.
He then went inside to eat and drink. After he had his fill, he gave instructions.
They went out to clean up the mess and bury her body; but when they got there, they found a most haunting sight. All that remained was her skull, her feet, and the palms of her hands.
They went back and told Jehu this news, and he explained it to them.
